alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Taylor (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Taylor and northeastern Harrison Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 724 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Shinnston, or near Clarksburg, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Bridgeport, Shinnston, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Lumberport, Anmoore, Enterprise, Valley Falls, Rosemont, Meadland, McGee, Meadowbrook, and Despard. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 117 and 128. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 74 and 82. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
